160081-d-08-01-00-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Automatic hump retarder failed to sufficiently slow car due to foreign material on wheels of car bei
160081-d-08-01-00-SOO.Accident Cause: Automatic hump retarder failed to sufficiently slow car due to foreign material on wheels of car bei
160081-d-08-01-00-SOO.Narrative: 2300 HUMP WAS HUMPING 3 CAR CUTS OF CORN INTO C31.  PROYARDS ANNOUNCED A SEVERE OVERSPEED.  CARS COUPLED ONTO OTHER CARLOADS OF CORN ON WEST END OF TRACK AT EXCESSIVE SPEED CAUSING DAMAGE TO SOO 119826 AND SOO 118018.  CAUSE DETERMINED TO BE CONTAMINATED WHEELS CAUSING EXCESSIVE COUPLING SPEED.  INDUSTRY WAS CONTACTED ABOUT WHEEL CONTAMINATION.  DAMAGED CARS TAKEN TO CLEANING TRACK TO TRANSFER LADING.  FINAL CAUSE:  M407 AUTOMATIC HUMP RETARDER FAILED TO SUFFICIENTLY SLOW CAR DUE TO FOREIGN MATERIAL ON WHEELS OF CAR BEING              HUMPED.   ACCOUNTABLE COST CENTRE: THIRD PARTY  RECOMMENDEDCORRECTIVE ACTION # 1:  EXPLAIN POSSIBILITY OF WHEEL CONTAMINATIONS ON RAILCARS AT PEAVEY RED ROCKFACILITY FOLLOWING UNUSUALLY SEVERE RAIN STORMS TO CREWS SWITCHING THE FACILITY.  FURTHER, INSTRUCTCREWS TO INCLUDE WHEEL INSPECTION FOR CONTAMINATION DURING ROUTINE INSPECTION OF RAILCARS PRIOR TO PULLING FROM ANY SHIPPING FACILITY.  RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION # 2:  REMIND CAR DEPARTMENT EMPLOYEES TO INCLUDE INSPECTION OF WHEELS FOR CONTAMINATION DURING NORMAL INBOUND INSPECTIONS.  CONTRIBUTING FACTOR #1:   FAILURE TO IDENTIFY RAILCAR WHEEL CONTAMINATION ON INBOUND TRAIN INSPECTION.  A MAJOR CONTRIBUTING FACTOR IN THIS INCIDENT IS THE FACT THAT WE HAVE NOT EXPERIENCED ANY PROBLEMS, OR INCIDENTS, IN THE PAST WITH CONTAMINATED WHEELS ON CARS COMING OUT OF THE NEWPORT INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT.RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION: ST. PAUL CAR DEPARTMENT TRAIN YARD CARMEN TO INCLUDE INSPE

G4841-d-08-25-00-WC.Narrative: BADGER MINING EMPLOYEES WERE HANDLING CARS AT THE TIME OF THIS INCIDENT ON THEIR TRACKS.  THE EMPLOYEES HAD CUT CARS OFF, BOTTLED THE AIR WHICH ALLOWED THEM TO ROLL DOWN OVER THE DERAIL AND ONTO THE WC SIDING.  THREE CARS WERE DERAILED BY THE INDUSTRY EMPLOYEES.  SINCE THE INDUSTRY WAS CONTROLLING THE CARS AT THE TIME, IT IS UNKNOWN HOW FAST THE CARS WERE MOVING WHEN THEY DERAILED.  ONE CAR ENDEDON ITS SIDE, ANOTHER WAS TIPPED AND THE THIRD CAR WAS DERAILED UPRIGHT. NO WISCONSIN CENTRAL EMPLOYEE WAS INVOLVED IN THIS INCIDENT.  THE CARS WERE UNDER THE INDUSTRY'S CONTROL AND ENDED UP CAUSING DAMAGE TO SIDING TRACK OWNED BY WISCONSIN CENTRAL.  WISCONSIN CENTRAL DID REPAIR THE CARS THAT WERE DAMAGED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

080800-d-08-08-00-AWW.Contributing Accident Cause: Other extreme environmental conditions (Provide detailed description in narrative)
080800-d-08-08-00-AWW.Narrative: ON AUGUST 8, 2000, AT ABOUT 11:10 AM, AN AWW UNIT COAL TRAIN CONSISTING OF 3 ENGINES AND 107 LOADEDCOAL CARS SLIPPED DOWN DURING A BLINDING RAIN STORM ON A HILL ABOUT 2 MILES FROM THE AWW YARD.  THECREW HAD TO DOUBLE THE TRAIN INTO THE YARD.  AS THE CREW WAS SHOVING THE FIRST CUT OF 60 CARS INTO THE YARD THEY RAN THROUGH A SWITCH WITHOUT REALIZING IT.  THEY LEFT THIS CUT IN THE YARD, GOT THE SECOND CUT, AND YARDED IT, FINISHING AT 12:35 PM.  THIS AWW CREW WENT OFF DUTY AT 12:40 PM.  AS SOON ASTHE AWW CREW HAD ITS ENGINES OUT OF THE WAY, THE ISRR CREW, WHICH HAD BEEN WAITING TO PULL THIS UNIT COAL TRAIN, COUPLED INTO THE FIRST CUT, WHICH WAS SITTING ON THE RUN-THROUGH SWITCH.  WHEN THEY STARTED TO MOVE THIS CUT OF CARS, 3 CARS DERAILED ON THE SWITCH.  THE FIRST CAR DERAILED ALSO HIT THEREAR CAR OF THE SECOND CUT WHICH WAS SITTING ON THE ADJACENT TRACK.  CONTRIBUTING CODE M199:  EXTREMELY HEAVY DOWNPOUR CAUSING THE TRAIN TO SLIP DOWN IN THE FIRST PLACE AND THE CONDUCTOR TO NOT SEE THE SWITCH WAS LINED WRONG.NoneNoneNoneNone
